intro: Cusickiella quadricostata, commonly known as the four-costate spurge, is a flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and marshes. The plant features simple, alternate leaves with a distinctive four-ribbed structure along the stem. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, which are characteristic of the spurge family. Cusickiella quadricostata is often found in the eastern United States, particularly in swampy areas.
